parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Salamis, a city at the eastern end of Cyprus. Probably from salos; Salamis, a place in Cyprus.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To declare openly, proclaim, preach, laud, celebrate. From kata and the base of aggelos; to proclaim, promulgate.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Jewish. From Iouda; Judaean, i.e. Belonging to Jehudah.
From sunago; an assemblage of persons; specially, a Jewish 'synagogue'; by analogy, a Christian church.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Of Hebrew origin; Joannes, the name of four Israelites.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
From hupo and a derivative of eresso; an under-oarsman, i.e. subordinate.
